snippet: Two car bombs exploded outside a key intelligence compound in Damascus on Thursday, leaving 55 dead and nearly 400 wounded.
abstract: Twin suicide car bombs that targeted a notorious military intelligence compound shake the Syrian capital of Damascus, killing people and raising the likelihood of extremist elements propelling the conflict in the country to a more treacherous phase.

byline.contributor: Jack Healy contributed reporting from Baghdad, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: Two car bombs exploded outside a key intelligence compound in Damascus on Thursday, leaving 55 dead and nearly 400 wounded.

headline.main: Dozens Killed in Large Explosions in Syrian Capital
headline.print_headline: Syrian Intelligence Compound Is Target of 2 Bombs
